articles.headline: Obama Fuels Pullout Debate With Remarks
articles.snippet: Change in Iraq has posed a challenge for Barack Obama, who said he might “refine” his policies but later held a news conference to clarify his statement.
articles.abstract: Change in Iraq has posed a challenge for Barack Obama, who said he might “refine” his policies but later held a news conference to clarify his statement.
articles.lead_paragraph: Senator Barack Obama said Thursday that he might “refine” his policies for Iraq after meeting with military commanders there later this summer. But hours later he held a second news conference to emphasize his commitment to the withdrawal of all combat troops from Iraq within 16 months of taking office.
articles.byline: By Michael Cooper and Jeff Zeleny

articles.headline: Fighting Inflation, Europeans Raise Rate
articles.snippet: The European Central Bank, spooked by soaring prices for food and fuel, raised its benchmark interest rate a quarter of a percentage point to 4.25 percent.
articles.abstract: The European Central Bank, spooked by soaring prices for food and fuel, raised its benchmark interest rate a quarter of a percentage point to 4.25 percent.
articles.lead_paragraph: FRANKFURT — For the European Central Bank, dedicated to slaying the dragon of inflation, the moment of truth arrived Thursday. The bank raised its benchmark interest rate a quarter of a percentage point to 4.25 percent, making good on a promise last month that it would act to curb food and fuel prices.

articles.headline: In a Bright Side to the Slowdown, Shopping Bargains Abound
articles.snippet: Anyone who has managed to forget about fuel prices long enough to enjoy a little retail therapy knows some steep discounts are available these days.
articles.abstract: Anyone who has managed to forget about fuel prices long enough to enjoy a little retail therapy knows some steep discounts are available these days.
articles.lead_paragraph: Anyone who has managed to forget about fuel prices long enough to enjoy a little retail therapy knows some steep discounts are available these days.

articles.headline: Outlook Darker as Jobs Are Lost
articles.snippet: The unemployment rate held steady as 62,000 jobs disappeared in June, the Labor Department reported.
articles.abstract: The unemployment rate held steady as 62,000 jobs disappeared in June, the Labor Department reported.
articles.lead_paragraph: The nation’s employers eliminated tens of thousands of jobs in June for the sixth consecutive month in a steady chipping away of the work force that seems likely to leave the economy very weak through Election Day.

articles.headline: Lax Real Estate Decisions Hurt Starbucks
articles.snippet: Starbucks’s biggest mistakes and greatest challenges boil down to three words: location, location and location.
articles.abstract: Starbucks’s biggest mistakes and greatest challenges boil down to three words: location, location and location.
articles.lead_paragraph: Starbucks wants to get back to its roots to help turn around its ailing fortunes. It brought back the pioneering chief executive Howard Schultz to run the coffee chain day to day, and it has introduced a new blend, Pike Place Roast, that harks back to the location of its first Seattle store.

articles.headline: Bold Colombia Rescue Built on Rebel Group’s Disarray
articles.snippet: The Colombian military duped FARC guerrillas in a raid that freed 15 hostages, an action that some analysts suggested might help push the rebels to negotiate for peace.
articles.abstract: The Colombian military duped FARC guerrillas in a raid that freed 15 hostages, an action that some analysts suggested might help push the rebels to negotiate for peace.
articles.lead_paragraph: BOGOTÁ, Colombia  At 5 a.m. on Wednesday, the sun had yet to peek through the jungle canopy in this country’s Guaviare Department when the guerrillas told their captives to gather their belongings. A call had come in from a top adviser to Alfonso Cano, their new supreme commander. He said to move. Immediately.
articles.byline: By Simon Romero and Damien Cave

articles.headline: Inexperience May Feed the Bubbles
articles.snippet: Two professors found that younger fund managers became more swept up in the euphoria over technology stocks.
articles.abstract: Two professors found that younger fund managers became more swept up in the euphoria over technology stocks.
articles.lead_paragraph: It has long been widely believed  at least among some experienced investors  that it is the inexperienced ones who are most likely to get swept into the euphoria of a bubble and to buy when prices are the most absurd.

articles.headline: Google Told to Turn Over User Data of YouTube
articles.snippet: The order raised concerns that the online video viewing habits of tens of millions of people could be exposed.
articles.abstract: The order raised concerns that the online video viewing habits of tens of millions of people could be exposed.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO  A federal judge has ordered Google to turn over to Viacom its records of which users watched which videos on YouTube, the Web’s largest video site by far.
